questions.question: In a counter-flow heat exchanger, a hot fluid is cooled from 100°C to 70°C by using a cold fluid that gets heated from 25°C to 55°C. The LMTD value of the heat exchanger is
NTU effectiveness method for the analysis of heat exchanger is used when:

answers.a: outlet temperatures of both fluids are known but inlet temperatures are unknown
answers.b: inlet temperatures of both fluids are known but outlet temperatures are unknown
answers.c: outlet temperatures of any one fluid is known
answers.d: inlet temperatures of any one fluid is known

questions.question: Which of the following heat exchangers gives parallel and linear temperature profile for both cold and hot fluid?

answers.a: Parallel flow with unequal heat capacities
answers.b: Counter flow with equal heat capacities
answers.c: Parallel flow with equal heat capacities
answers.d: Crossed flow with unequal heat capacities

questions.question: In a heat exchanger, it is observed that ΔT1 = ΔT2, where ΔT1 is the temperature difference between the two single phase fluid streams at one end and ΔT2 is the temperature difference at the other end. This heat exchanger is

TIn a double-pipe heat exchanger, the cold fluid is water with an inlet temperature 20°C and mass flow rate 20 kg/s and the hot fluid water inlet temperature 80°C and mass flow rate 10 kg/s. Assume that for water Cp = 4.2 kJ/kg°C, independent of temperature. What is the maximum temperature to which the cold fluid can be heated in a parallel flow and in a counter flow heat exchanger?

answers.a: 80°C in both parallel flow and counter flow
answers.b: 50°C in both parallel flow and counter flow
answers.c: 40°C in parallel flow and 50°C in counter flow
answers.d: 40°C in parallel flow and 80°C in counter flow
